intro: Tithymalus graecus, commonly known as the Greek tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Tithymalus graecus is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
